intro: Hemichlaena bulbosa, commonly known as the bulbous hemichlaena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its bulbous storage structures and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that emerge from the base of the bulb. Hemichlaena bulbosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shady areas.
